result.execSummary:
The defendant Alvin B McFeely was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Forgery-Uttering [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Forgery-Uttering [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay restitution as shown on Door County Restitution Summary, plus statutorily authorized surcharges. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay costs on each count of the action. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
No contact direct or indirect with victim.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.
Obtain AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.

timeConds.notes: Stayed as long as Defendant is paying minimum of $100 per month toward financial obligations on this case. Huber privileges granted if stay is lifted.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alvin B McFeely

defendant.name: McFeely, Alvin B
defendant.address: 762 Georgia St Unit C, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant waives reading of Information. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest pleas to Counts 1, 2, 3. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds pleas made freely and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds Defendant guilty of Counts 1, 2, 3. Court questions Defendant, who agrees with repeater status. Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Counts 4, 5, 6 are dismissed but read in for sentencing and/or restitution. Court questions State/Defendant, who are not requesting PSI. State makes sentencing recommendations. Bond no longer in effect.

Defendant Alvin B McFeely in court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, previous activity. Defendant wants to accept State's offer. Court questions Defendant on continued waiver of right to Counsel, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily. Court questions Defendant on waiver of preliminary hearing, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial.
No contact direct or indirect with HC, DC Docks and Boatlifts, Inc.

Defendant Alvin B McFeely in court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim. Defendant wants to try to resolve matter with DA, waives right to Counsel. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver. Defendant to make appointment with DA. Bond set.  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2016 at 10:30 am.
